      double[] score(double nGramCount, int actualNGramCount, double historySum, int actualHistorySum, double diversityOfFutureSum, double[] diversityOfHistory)

    • Method Detail

      • score

        double[] score(double nGramCount,
             int actualNGramCount,
             double historySum,
             int actualHistorySum,
             double diversityOfFutureSum,
             double[] diversityOfHistory)
        For a n-gram w1w2w3 the scores are as follows
        Parameters:
        nGramCount - The (modified) nGram score c*(w1w2w3)
        actualNGramCount - The (actual) nGram score c(w1w2w3)
        futureSum - The (modified) history sum \Sum_w c*(w1w2w)
        actualFutureSum - The (actual) nGram score \Sum_w c(w1w2w)
        diversityOfHistory - The diversity of future #{ w | ww1w2w3 \in corpus }
        diversityOfHistorySum - The sum diversity of futures #{ (w,w') | ww1w2w' \in corpus }
        diversityOfFutures - The sums given as dOH[i] = #{ w | c(w1w2w) = i }. Not the last value is treated as i or greater
        Returns:
        The score as a 1 or 2-dim array representing probability and back-off score
